Record Class BoardTransition

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
engine.forPlayer.BoardTransition
Record Components:
transitionBoard - The chessboard state resulting from the move execution.
moveStatus - The status indicating the outcome of the move attempt.
public record BoardTransition(Board transitionBoard, MoveStatus moveStatus) extends Record
The BoardTransition class represents the result of a move execution on the chessboard. It encapsulates both the resulting board state after a move is applied and the status indicating whether the move was successful, illegal, or resulted in check. This immutable record provides a clean way to return move execution results from the chess engine's move validation and execution pipeline.

BoardTransition instances are created whenever a move is attempted, allowing the caller to inspect both the outcome and the resulting position in a single return value.

Author:
dareTo81, Aaron Ho

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardTransition

      public BoardTransition(Board transitionBoard, MoveStatus moveStatus)
      Constructs a BoardTransition with the specified resulting board and move status. This compact constructor validates that both parameters are provided for the transition.
      Parameters:
      transitionBoard - The chessboard state resulting from the move execution.
      moveStatus - The status indicating the outcome of the move attempt.

  • Method Details

    • transitionBoard

      public Board transitionBoard()
      Returns the board state that results from executing the move. This board represents the position after the move has been applied, regardless of whether the move was ultimately legal or successful.
      Returns:
      The resulting board state after move execution.

    • moveStatus

      public MoveStatus moveStatus()
      Returns the status indicating the outcome of the move execution. The status reveals whether the move completed successfully, was illegal, or left the player in an invalid state such as check.
      Returns:
      The move execution status.
